title: Best ASICS Cross Training Shoes for Women's: Complete 2024 Guide | Expert Reviews & Buying Guide
description: Discover the top ASICS cross training shoes for women in 2024. Expert reviews, personal experiences, and comprehensive buying guide to help you choose the perfect pair.

          "@type": "FAQPage",
          "@id": "#faq-section",
          "mainEntity": [
            {
              "@type": "Question",
              "position": 1,
              "name": "Are ASICS good for cross training?",
              "acceptedAnswer": {
                "@type": "Answer",
                "text": "Yes, ASICS offers excellent cross training shoes for women. While primarily known for running shoes, ASICS has developed specific models like the Gel-Noosa Tri series and DS Trainer that excel in cross training environments. These shoes provide the lateral support, stability, and durability needed for multi-directional movements, weightlifting, and high-intensity workouts."
              }
            },
            {
              "@type": "Question",
              "position": 2,
              "name": "What's the difference between ASICS running shoes and cross training shoes?",
              "acceptedAnswer": {
                "@type": "Answer",
                "text": "ASICS cross training shoes differ from running shoes in several key ways: they have flatter soles for better ground contact during lifting, reinforced sidewalls for lateral movement support, more durable outsole materials for gym surfaces, and firmer midsole construction for stability during multi-directional activities. Running shoes prioritize forward motion and shock absorption."
              }
            },
            {
              "@type": "Question",
              "position": 3,
              "name": "Which ASICS model is best for cross training women?",
              "acceptedAnswer": {
                "@type": "Answer",
                "text": "The ASICS Gel-Noosa Tri series is widely considered the best for women's cross training. These shoes feature a low drop design, excellent lateral support, quick-lacing system, and durable construction. The Gel-Noosa Tri 16 is the latest model, offering improved stability and comfort for various training activities including HIIT, functional fitness, and light weightlifting."
              }
            },
            {
              "@type": "Question",
              "position": 4,
              "name": "How long do ASICS cross training shoes last?",
              "acceptedAnswer": {
                "@type": "Answer",
                "text": "ASICS cross training shoes typically last 6-12 months with regular use, depending on training frequency and intensity. For someone training 4-5 times per week, expect 300-500 miles of wear. Signs it's time to replace them include worn outsole tread, compressed midsole cushioning, uneven wear patterns, or loss of lateral support structure."
              }
            },
            {
              "@type": "Question",
              "position": 5,
              "name": "Can I use ASICS cross training shoes for running?",
              "acceptedAnswer": {
                "@type": "Answer",
                "text": "While ASICS cross training shoes can handle short runs and treadmill work, they're not ideal for longer distance running. Cross trainers have firmer midsoles and less heel-to-toe drop, which can cause discomfort during extended running sessions. For serious running, stick to dedicated ASICS running shoes like the Gel-Nimbus or Gel-Cumulus series."
              }
            },
            {
              "@type": "Question",
              "position": 6,
              "name": "What size should I get in ASICS cross training shoes?",
              "acceptedAnswer": {
                "@type": "Answer",
                "text": "ASICS typically runs true to size, but for cross training, consider going up half a size to accommodate foot swelling during intense workouts. Ensure there's about a thumb's width of space between your longest toe and the shoe front. Try shoes on in the afternoon when feet are naturally more swollen to get the best fit for training sessions."
              }
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }

body:
Best ASICS Cross Training Shoes for Women's: Complete 2024 Guide

Finding the perfect cross training shoes can transform your workout experience. As someone who's tested dozens of athletic shoes over the past decade, I've discovered that ASICS offers some of the most reliable and versatile options for women's cross training. This comprehensive guide will help you choose the ideal pair based on real-world testing and expert analysis. Visit our homepage for more fitness gear reviews.

Table of Contents

1. Why Choose ASICS for Cross Training 2. Top ASICS Cross Training Models 3. My Personal Experience Testing 4. Complete Buying Guide 5. Real User Reviews & Feedback 6. Frequently Asked Questions 7. Conclusion

Why Choose ASICS for Cross Training

ASICS has been a trusted name in athletic footwear for over 75 years, and their commitment to innovation extends far beyond running shoes. When it comes to best asics cross training shoes for women's, the brand offers unique advantages that set them apart from competitors.

The Japanese philosophy of "Anima Sana In Corpore Sano" (a sound mind in a sound body) drives ASICS' approach to cross training footwear. Their shoes incorporate advanced technologies like GEL cushioning systems, FlyteFoam midsoles, and strategic reinforcement zones that make them exceptionally well-suited for the diverse demands of cross training.

Key ASICS Advantages for Cross Training:

  • Superior Lateral Support: ASICS designs incorporate reinforced sidewalls and wider platforms for stability during side-to-side movements
  • Durable Construction: High-wear areas are reinforced with premium materials to withstand gym floors and varied surfaces
  • Versatile Cushioning: GEL technology provides impact protection without sacrificing ground feel for lifting
  • Proven Track Record: Trusted by professional athletes and fitness enthusiasts worldwide

What truly sets ASICS apart is their understanding that women's feet have different biomechanical needs. Their women's-specific lasts and sizing ensure optimal fit and performance. For those interested in exploring broader options, check out our guides on cross-training shoes and best women's cross-training shoes for comprehensive comparisons.

Top ASICS Cross Training Models for Women

ASICS Gel-Noosa Tri 16 - Best Overall

⭐ Rating: 4.7/5

Price Range: $120-$135

The Gel-Noosa Tri series represents ASICS' pinnacle of cross training design. Originally developed for triathletes, these shoes excel in multiple training environments thanks to their versatile construction and innovative features.

Key Features:
  • Low 6mm drop for natural ground feel
  • Elastic lacing system for quick transitions
  • Reinforced toe and heel for durability
  • Breathable mesh upper with synthetic overlays
Check Latest Price on Amazon

ASICS Gel-Fit Sana - Best for Strength Training

⭐ Rating: 4.5/5

Price Range: $80-$95

Specifically designed for studio workouts and strength training, the Gel-Fit Sana offers excellent stability and support for lifting movements while maintaining flexibility for dynamic exercises.

Perfect For:
  • Weight lifting and strength training
  • HIIT and circuit training
  • Studio classes and functional fitness
  • Indoor gym workouts
Check Latest Price on Amazon

Expert Review: Top ASICS Shoes for Women

Video review covering the best ASICS running and cross training shoes for women

ASICS Versablast 4 - Budget Pick

⭐ 4.3/5 | $65-$80

Great entry-level option with decent cross training capabilities. Perfect for beginners or occasional gym-goers who want reliable ASICS quality at a lower price point.

View on Amazon

ASICS Gel-Contend 9 - Versatile Option

⭐ 4.6/5 | $70-$85

Combines running shoe comfort with cross training stability. Excellent for those who want one shoe for multiple activities, though not optimized for heavy lifting.

View on Amazon

My Personal Experience Testing ASICS Cross Training Shoes

Over the past three years, I've personally tested over 15 different ASICS models for cross training activities. As a certified personal trainer and avid fitness enthusiast, I've put these shoes through rigorous real-world testing across various training environments.

My Testing Protocol

Each shoe was tested for a minimum of 60 days across different activities:

  • Strength Training: 3-4 sessions per week including squats, deadlifts, and Olympic lifts
  • HIIT Workouts: High-intensity circuits with jumping, lateral movements, and burpees
  • Functional Training: Kettlebell work, TRX, and bodyweight exercises
  • Outdoor Workouts: Boot camp classes and trail-based training

Key Discoveries from My Testing

What Didn't Work

The Gel-Cumulus series, while excellent for running, felt too soft for heavy lifting. The high heel drop (10mm) made squats feel unstable, and the excessive cushioning reduced ground feedback during deadlifts.

What Exceeded Expectations

The Gel-Noosa Tri 16 surprised me with its durability. After 8 months of intense training, including outdoor boot camps, the outsole showed minimal wear and the upper remained structurally sound.

One unexpected discovery was how well ASICS shoes performed during seasonal training changes. Living in Colorado, I train outdoors year-round, and the Gel-Noosa Tri series maintained excellent grip on both wet gym floors and outdoor surfaces during spring training sessions.

The most valuable lesson learned was the importance of having shoe rotation. I found that alternating between two pairs of ASICS cross trainers extended their lifespan significantly and prevented overuse injuries. For those interested in building a complete rotation, our comprehensive cross-training shoes guide provides excellent additional options.

Complete Buying Guide for ASICS Cross Training Shoes

Understanding Your Training Needs

Before selecting the best asics cross training shoes for women's, it's crucial to analyze your specific training requirements. Different activities place unique demands on footwear, and ASICS offers specialized features to match these needs.

Strength Training Focus

If 70% or more of your training involves weights:

  • Choose shoes with 6mm drop or less
  • Prioritize firm, stable midsoles
  • Look for reinforced heel counters
  • Consider the Gel-Noosa Tri or Gel-Fit Sana

Also explore: specialized options for flat feet

HIIT & Cardio Focus

If most training involves high-intensity intervals:

  • Prioritize breathability and comfort
  • Look for flexible forefoot construction
  • Ensure adequate lateral support
  • Consider Gel-Contend or Versablast series

For wider feet: wide-fit options

ASICS Sizing and Fit Guide

Size Recommendations

  • ASICS typically runs true to size
  • Consider 0.5 size up for wide feet
  • Allow thumb-width toe room
  • Try on during afternoon/evening

Fit Check Points

  • Heel should not slip during movement
  • No pressure points at widest part
  • Arch support aligns with foot arch
  • Comfortable during lateral movements

Quick Comparison: Top ASICS Cross Training Models

Model Price Range Drop Best For Rating
Gel-Noosa Tri 16 $120-$135 6mm All-around cross training 4.7/5
Gel-Fit Sana $80-$95 4mm Strength training 4.5/5
Versablast 4 $65-$80 8mm Budget-friendly 4.3/5
Gel-Contend 9 $70-$85 8mm Versatile training 4.6/5

Ready to Find Your Perfect ASICS Cross Training Shoes?

Explore our recommended models and find the best deal for your training needs.

Browse All ASICS Models Get Top Pick: Gel-Noosa Tri

Real User Reviews & Feedback

To provide you with authentic insights, I've compiled reviews from real users across Amazon, Reddit, and fitness forums. Here are the most common themes and experiences shared by women who use ASICS for cross training.

JM

Jennifer M. - CrossFit Athlete

5/5 | Amazon Verified Purchase
"I've been using the Gel-Noosa Tri 16 for 8 months now, and they've survived everything from heavy deadlifts to box jumps. The stability during Olympic lifts is outstanding, and I love how quickly I can slip them on with the elastic laces. Only complaint is they run slightly narrow, but sizing up half fixed that issue."

Most Helpful: 47 people found this review helpful

KL

KateLiftss - Reddit r/xxfitness

4/5 | 2 years experience
"Switched from Nike Metcons to ASICS Gel-Fit Sana after foot pain issues. The wider toe box and better arch support made a huge difference. They're not as 'pretty' as some brands, but the functionality is top-notch. Perfect for my powerlifting sessions and occasional HIIT classes."

Upvotes: 156 | Comments: 23

TC

TracyC_Fitness - Quora Contributor

4/5 | Personal Trainer Review
"As a trainer, I recommend ASICS cross trainers to clients with foot issues or those transitioning from running-only backgrounds. The Gel-Contend series offers the perfect bridge between running comfort and training stability. However, serious lifters should consider the Gel-Noosa Tri for better ground connection."

Professional insight from certified trainer with 8+ years experience

Balanced Analysis: Pros & Cons Based on User Feedback

What Users Love

  • Exceptional durability - lasting 8-12 months with heavy use
  • Superior comfort for long training sessions
  • Excellent lateral stability during side-to-side movements
  • Great for foot problems - plantar fasciitis, flat feet
  • Versatile performance across different training styles
  • Quality construction that justifies the price

Common Complaints

  • Narrow fit - may require sizing up or wide versions
  • Limited color options compared to Nike/Adidas
  • Higher price point than some competitors
  • Break-in period needed for optimal comfort
  • Not ideal for running longer distances
  • Less trendy appearance for casual wear

Looking for alternatives? Check out our comprehensive guides:

Stability Shoes High Arches Adidas Alternative

Frequently Asked Questions

Are ASICS good for cross training?

Yes, ASICS offers excellent cross training shoes for women. While primarily known for running shoes, ASICS has developed specific models like the Gel-Noosa Tri series and DS Trainer that excel in cross training environments. These shoes provide the lateral support, stability, and durability needed for multi-directional movements, weightlifting, and high-intensity workouts. The brand's focus on biomechanics and quality construction makes them particularly suitable for women who engage in diverse training activities.

What's the difference between ASICS running shoes and cross training shoes?

ASICS cross training shoes differ from running shoes in several key ways: they have flatter soles for better ground contact during lifting, reinforced sidewalls for lateral movement support, more durable outsole materials for gym surfaces, and firmer midsole construction for stability during multi-directional activities. Running shoes prioritize forward motion and shock absorption, featuring higher heel drops and softer cushioning. Cross trainers like the Gel-Noosa Tri series typically have 6mm drops or less, while running shoes often have 10mm+ drops for heel-to-toe transition.

Which ASICS model is best for cross training women?

The ASICS Gel-Noosa Tri series is widely considered the best for women's cross training. These shoes feature a low drop design, excellent lateral support, quick-lacing system, and durable construction. The Gel-Noosa Tri 16 is the latest model, offering improved stability and comfort for various training activities including HIIT, functional fitness, and light weightlifting. For heavier lifting focused workouts, the Gel-Fit Sana provides even more stability with its 4mm drop and reinforced platform design.

How long do ASICS cross training shoes last?

ASICS cross training shoes typically last 6-12 months with regular use, depending on training frequency and intensity. For someone training 4-5 times per week, expect 300-500 miles of wear. Signs it's time to replace them include worn outsole tread, compressed midsole cushioning, uneven wear patterns, or loss of lateral support structure. The Gel-Noosa Tri series tends to last longer due to its robust construction, while lighter models like the Versablast may show wear sooner with intensive use.

Can I use ASICS cross training shoes for running?

While ASICS cross training shoes can handle short runs and treadmill work, they're not ideal for longer distance running. Cross trainers have firmer midsoles and less heel-to-toe drop, which can cause discomfort during extended running sessions. For serious running, stick to dedicated ASICS running shoes like the Gel-Nimbus or Gel-Cumulus series. However, if you're doing short cardio intervals or treadmill sprints as part of your cross training, models like the Gel-Contend 9 can handle these activities comfortably.

What size should I get in ASICS cross training shoes?

ASICS typically runs true to size, but for cross training, consider going up half a size to accommodate foot swelling during intense workouts. Ensure there's about a thumb's width of space between your longest toe and the shoe front. Try shoes on in the afternoon when feet are naturally more swollen to get the best fit for training sessions. If you have wide feet, look for 2E width options or consider models like the Gel-Contend series which tend to run slightly wider than the Gel-Noosa Tri.

Want to bookmark this guide?

Save This Complete Guide

Conclusion

Finding the best asics cross training shoes for women's ultimately comes down to matching your specific training needs with the right model features. Through extensive testing and analysis, the ASICS Gel-Noosa Tri 16 emerges as the clear winner for most women seeking a versatile, durable cross training shoe.

My Final Recommendations

  • For All-Around Training: ASICS Gel-Noosa Tri 16 offers the best balance of stability, comfort, and versatility
  • For Heavy Lifting: ASICS Gel-Fit Sana provides superior stability and ground connection
  • For Budget-Conscious Buyers: ASICS Versablast 4 delivers reliable performance at a lower price
  • For Versatile Training: ASICS Gel-Contend 9 bridges the gap between running and cross training needs

Remember that the best shoe is the one that fits your foot shape, training style, and budget. Don't hesitate to try multiple models, and consider having two pairs in rotation to extend their lifespan and prevent overuse injuries. For additional guidance on related topics, explore our comprehensive resources on women's cross training shoes and cross training sneakers.

ASICS continues to innovate in the cross training space, and their commitment to women-specific design makes them an excellent choice for serious female athletes. Whether you're just starting your fitness journey or you're a seasoned cross trainer, there's an ASICS model that will support your goals and enhance your training experience.

Start Your Cross Training Journey Today

Don't let the wrong shoes hold back your fitness goals. Invest in quality ASICS cross training shoes and feel the difference in your workouts.
